alert.note: Alert for Todd; Tripp (South Dakota) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS RapidCity (Western South Dakota and Northeastern Wyoming)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 04 at 3:57PM MDT by NWS RapidCity
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southeastern Todd and southwestern Tripp Counties through 530 PM CDT... At 457 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 8 miles southwest of Keyapaha, or 17 miles northeast of Valentine, moving northeast at 15 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This storm will remain over mainly rural areas of southeastern Todd and southwestern Tripp Counties. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
